Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "We are interested in your feedback about the NuGet Gallery repo!" (#8345) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Thanks for all of your contributions to this project! We have created a survey that we hope allows us to learn what works and what needs attention. It's a little bit less than 30 questions, many of them multiple-choice questions. If maybe takes 10 minutes to complete and it‚Äôs anonymous. Your responses will help us make your experience better in this repo.

https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/92RLF7R?Source=NuGet/NuGetGallery

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Restrict package sources" (#8355) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Restrict package sources to those explicitly listed in the `nuget.config` file. This prevents build issues where packages may come from unexpected package sources due to other `nuget.config` files (see [this](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/consume-packages/configuring-nuget-behavior#config-file-locations-and-uses)).

Part of https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/3525

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y][WCAG2.1][Reflow]Dropdown information is cut off when zoomed in." (#8285) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1188115

# Environment Details:
#URL:Application URL for NuGet Service
Browser Details:
Firefox Version: 79.0 (64 bit)

# OS Details
Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise  ‚Äã

Version 2004 (OS Build 19041.450) 



# Note: 
Under 'Members' Administrator dropdown is not visible clearly after applying reflow
# Repro Steps:
Change the Display resolution to 1280*1024 in System display settings
Hit the URL and login with appropriate credentials
Tab till "Open Profile drop down" and press enter
Tab till "Manage organizations" and Press enter
Tab till "Edit " present in any record the table and press enter
Tab till Certificates and expand it 
Apply reflow and Check whether data is missing or not  
### Actual Results:

Some of the data is missing when reflow is applied under the Certificates
### Expected Results:
User should be able to view the data without missing and all the information should be visible clearly with one scrollbar after applying reflow
### User Impact:
Users will not be able to see the information if it gets overlapped in reflow

# Notes:
We will probably want to update the layout to move the dropdown to the next line when the horizontal width is below a certain amount.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Add vulnerabilities service" (#8357) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Starts to address: https://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues/7650.

PR https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/8356 must be merged before this one.

Here I introduce the new package vulnerability service. This service's job is simple at this point--return a dictionary of package keys with a list of vulnerabilities for each. Some plumbing is also added to make those values available to view models.

There is also the renaming of an EF navigation property Vulnerabilities to VulnerablePackageRanges, which is more representative.

Again, a few files here, but there's quite a bit of repetition for the rename and plumbing.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Rename vulnerability management service, add feature flag" (#8356) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Starts to address: https://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues/7650

This is a rename of the existing vulnerability service to a vulnerability management service, and the vulnerability service verifier to a vulnerability verifier. Quite a few files in this PR, but it's very repetitive.

Also, I've introduced a feature flag here for use in vulnerability messaging.

This is all groundwork for the PRs to follow.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "_GenerateRestoreProjectPathWalk is too slow." (#10403) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

Latest stable dotnet and all previous versions that I know of are affected.
ALL OS
ALL environments
Worked before? No

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Have a complex solution with dependencies all over the place

2. Execute `dotnet restore /clp:PerformanceSummary SolutionName.sln`

3. 124286 ms  _GenerateRestoreProjectPathWalk          257 calls
 
### Verbose Logs
I can't provide these. 


I believe this abomination is the reason: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/b0fef98e6328948e7669297d6869fa792b39e805/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Build.Tasks/NuGet.targets#L1050  
I don't know if this sorts the lists, compares sanely, uses keys, hashtables or whatnot properly or not. And I think this repeats some work because I see no way an XML like that is deserialized into an object that understand the context properly. 
Anyway, where I come from it takes at most a millisecond to insert ~250 nodes in a dependency tree. not 124 seconds. And I can't understand how on earth a high profile project could let this be. Wasn't there anyone involved in the project that would say "The dependency resolver is the most interesting part of any build system and I'm gonna science the shit out of it?"

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How to run specific unit test?" (#10388) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I have file with failed unit tests, I found list of failed unit tests by running `Select-String -Pattern Result .\build\TestResults\CoreUnitTests-xunit.xml | Select-String -NotMatch -Pattern Pass | Select-String -NotMatch -Pattern Skip`

What's the way how to run single unit test?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "dotnet add package returns local source not found" (#10402) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
When I do dotnet nuget list source, it shows the following sources:
* nuget.org
* mysource

However, when I run `dotnet add package <packageID> -s mysource`, it returns local source `mysource` doesn't exist

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Improve documentation on IVs APIs" (#7161) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
We have had a few Watson issues that have come because we don't have good documentation on what exceptions are being thrown from IVs APIs and what the user has to handle and expect.

We need to improve the documentation on these APIs so that users can properly handle and take action when our APIs throw exceptions to them.

Some of the issues are:
[654377](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/654377)
[654374](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/654374)
[652577](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/652577)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Visual Studio unable to restore packages and build solution" (#10401) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

dotnet.exe --version: 5.0.100

VS version: VisualStudio.16.Release/16.8.3+30804.86

OS version: Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.21277.1000]

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Delete the **.vs** folder
2. Delete all **bin** and **obj** folders
3. Open the solution in Visual Studio
   1. Visual Studio should restore packages, but doesn't
      1. Visual Studio should show solution packages in NuGet UI, but doesn't
      2. Running `dotnet restore` solves this.
   2. Visual Studio should build the solution but doesn't
      1. Running `dotnet build` solves this.

#### global.json
```JSON
{
  "sdk": {
    "version": "5.0.100",
    "rollForward": "disable",
    "allowPrerelease": true
  }
}
```

#### Directory.Build.props
```XML
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<Project>

  <PropertyGroup>
    <DebugType>embedded</DebugType>
    <DebugSymbols>true</DebugSymbols>
    <Nullable>enable</Nullable>
    <LangVersion>preview</LangVersion>
    <GenerateAssemblyVersionInfo>true</GenerateAssemblyVersionInfo>
    <NBGV_EmitThisAssemblyClass>false</NBGV_EmitThisAssemblyClass>
  </PropertyGroup>

  <ItemGroup>
    <PackageReference Include="Nerdbank.GitVersioning"
                      Version="3.3.37"
                      PrivateAssets="all"
                      IncludeAssets="runtime; build; native; contentfiles; analyzers; buildtransitive" />
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.SourceLink.AzureRepos.Git"
                      Version="1.1.0-beta-20204-02"
                      PrivateAssets="all" />
  </ItemGroup>

  <!--Build metadata to add to build number-->
  <ItemGroup>
    <BuildMetadata Condition="'$(Build_Reason)' != ''" Include="$(Build_Reason)" />
    <BuildMetadata Condition="'$(Build_SourceBranchName)' != ''" Include="$(Build_SourceBranchName)" />
  </ItemGroup>

</Project>
```

#### Directory.Build.targets
```XML
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<Project>

  <Target Name="__SetBuildNumberAndId"
          DependsOnTargets="GetBuildVersion"
          BeforeTargets="GetAssemblyAttributes">
    
    <PropertyGroup>
      
      <!--If NerdBank.GitVersionig is setting the build number-->
      <Build_BuildNumber Condition="'$(CloudBuildNumber)' != ''">$(CloudBuildNumber)</Build_BuildNumber>
    
    </PropertyGroup>
    
    <ItemGroup>
      
      <AssemblyAttribute Include="System.Reflection.AssemblyMetadataAttribute" Condition="$(Build_BuildNumber) != ''" >
        <_Parameter1>BuildNumber</_Parameter1>
        <_Parameter2>$(Build_BuildNumber)</_Parameter2>
      </AssemblyAttribute>
      
      <AssemblyAttribute Include="System.Reflection.AssemblyMetadataAttribute" Condition="$(Build_BuildId) != ''" >
        <_Parameter1>BuildId</_Parameter1>
        <_Parameter2>$(Build_BuildId)</_Parameter2>
      </AssemblyAttribute>
      
      <AssemblyAttribute Include="System.Reflection.AssemblyMetadataAttribute" Condition="$(GitCommitId) != ''" >
        <_Parameter1>GitCommitId</_Parameter1>
        <_Parameter2>$(GitCommitId)</_Parameter2>
      </AssemblyAttribute>
      
      <AssemblyAttribute Include="System.Reflection.AssemblyMetadataAttribute" Condition="$(GitCommitIdShort) != ''" >
        <_Parameter1>GitCommitIdShort</_Parameter1>
        <_Parameter2>$(GitCommitIdShort)</_Parameter2>
      </AssemblyAttribute>
    
    </ItemGroup>

  </Target>

  <Target Name="__ZipPublishedFiles"
          Condition="$(IsPublishable) == 'true' and '$(PublishZipDir)' != ''"
          DependsOnTargets="GetBuildVersion"
          AfterTargets="AfterPublish">

    <PropertyGroup>
      <PublishZipDir Condition="!HasTrailingSlash('$(PublishZipDir)')">$(PublishZipDir)\</PublishZipDir>
      <PublishZip>$(PublishZipDir)$(ProjectName)</PublishZip>
      <PublishZip Condition="$(NuGetPackageVersion) != ''">$(PublishZip).$(NuGetPackageVersion)</PublishZip>
      <PublishZip>$(PublishZip).zip</PublishZip>
    </PropertyGroup>

    <MakeDir Directories="$(PublishZipDir)" Condition="!Exists('$(PublishZipDir)')" />

    <ZipDirectory SourceDirectory="$(PublishDir)"
                  DestinationFile="$(PublishZip)"
                  Overwrite="true" />

    <RemoveDir Directories="$(PublishDir)" Condition="'$(RemovePublishDir)' == 'true'" />

  </Target>

</Project>
```

#### csproj
```XML
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk.Web">

  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFramework>net5.0</TargetFramework>
    <RuntimeIdentifier>win-x86</RuntimeIdentifier>
    <DebugType>embedded</DebugType>
    <DebugSymbols>true</DebugSymbols>
    <IsPublishable>true</IsPublishable>
    <UserSecretsId>0dc62f18-5c85-4829-9b06-32cf8ae1c37b</UserSecretsId>
    <EnableNETAnalyzers>true</EnableNETAnalyzers>
    <AnalysisMode>AllEnabledByDefault</AnalysisMode>
    <EnforceCodeStyleInBuild>true</EnforceCodeStyleInBuild>
  </PropertyGroup>

  <ItemGroup>
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.Extensions.Http.Polly" Version="5.0.1" />
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.VisualStudio.Web.CodeGeneration.Design" Version="5.0.1" />
    <PackageReference Include="Polly.Contrib.WaitAndRetry" Version="1.1.1" />
    <PackageReference Include="System.ServiceModel.Syndication" Version="5.0.0" />
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.JwtBearer" Version="5.0.1" />
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.OpenIdConnect" Version="5.0.1" />
  </ItemGroup>

  <ItemGroup>
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.CodeAnalysis" Version="3.8.0">
      <PrivateAssets>all</PrivateAssets>
      <IncludeAssets>runtime; build; native; contentfiles; analyzers; buildtransitive</IncludeAssets>
    </PackageReference>
    <PackageReference Include="ClrHeapAllocationAnalyzer" Version="3.0.0">
      <PrivateAssets>all</PrivateAssets>
      <IncludeAssets>runtime; build; native; contentfiles; analyzers; buildtransitive</IncludeAssets>
    </PackageReference>
  </ItemGroup>

</Project>
```

Note: Solution sent privately to the team

## Details about Problem

#### Directory.Build.targets
```XML

        <_Parameter2>$(Build_BuildNumber)</_Parameter2>
      </AssemblyAttribute>
      
      <AssemblyAttribute Include="System.Reflection.AssemblyMetadataAttribute" Condition="$(Build_BuildId) != ''" >
        <_Parameter1>BuildId</_Parameter1>
        <_Parameter2>$(Build_BuildId)</_Parameter2>
      </AssemblyAttribute>
      
      <AssemblyAttribute Include="System.Reflection.AssemblyMetadataAttribute" Condition="$(GitCommitId) != ''" >
        <_Parameter1>GitCommitId</_Parameter1>
        <_Parameter2>$(GitCommitId)</_Parameter2>
      </AssemblyAttribute>
      
      <AssemblyAttribute Include="System.Reflection.AssemblyMetadataAttribute" Condition="$(GitCommitIdShort) != ''" >
        <_Parameter1>GitCommitIdShort</_Parameter1>
        <_Parameter2>$(GitCommitIdShort)</_Parameter2>
      </AssemblyAttribute>
    
    </ItemGroup>

  </Target>

  <Target Name="__ZipPublishedFiles"
          Condition="$(IsPublishable) == 'true' and '$(PublishZipDir)' != ''"
          DependsOnTargets="GetBuildVersion"
          AfterTargets="AfterPublish">

    <PropertyGroup>
      <PublishZipDir Condition="!HasTrailingSlash('$(PublishZipDir)')">$(PublishZipDir)\</PublishZipDir>
      <PublishZip>$(PublishZipDir)$(ProjectName)</PublishZip>
      <PublishZip Condition="$(NuGetPackageVersion) != ''">$(PublishZip).$(NuGetPackageVersion)</PublishZip>
      <PublishZip>$(PublishZip).zip</PublishZip>
    </PropertyGroup>

    <MakeDir Directories="$(PublishZipDir)" Condition="!Exists('$(PublishZipDir)')" />

    <ZipDirectory SourceDirectory="$(PublishDir)"
                  DestinationFile="$(PublishZip)"
                  Overwrite="true" />

    <RemoveDir Directories="$(PublishDir)" Condition="'$(RemovePublishDir)' == 'true'" />

  </Target>

</Project>
```

#### csproj
```XML

  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFramework>net5.0</TargetFramework>
    <RuntimeIdentifier>win-x86</RuntimeIdentifier>
    <DebugType>embedded</DebugType>
    <DebugSymbols>true</DebugSymbols>
    <IsPublishable>true</IsPublishable>
    <UserSecretsId>0dc62f18-5c85-4829-9b06-32cf8ae1c37b</UserSecretsId>
    <EnableNETAnalyzers>true</EnableNETAnalyzers>
    <AnalysisMode>AllEnabledByDefault</AnalysisMode>
    <EnforceCodeStyleInBuild>true</EnforceCodeStyleInBuild>
  </PropertyGroup>

  <ItemGroup>
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.Extensions.Http.Polly" Version="5.0.1" />
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.VisualStudio.Web.CodeGeneration.Design" Version="5.0.1" />
    <PackageReference Include="Polly.Contrib.WaitAndRetry" Version="1.1.1" />

</Project>
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "November dry run for custom V2 OData query deprecation" (#48) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/37) last year and we will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in **February 2021**. 

We will conduct **a dry run of the OData deprecation** to ensure that there are no surprises for users, which is scheduled to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. The goal is to help you identify systems that may be affected and will give you an opportunity to take action before we permanently remove support for select v2 endpoints.
¬†
There will be two stages in the brown-out to accommodate a variety of usage scenarios. During these times, we will be heavily monitoring social media and other communication channels to address questions and concerns. 
	¬∑ **Nov. 11, 2020** ‚Äì 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each
	¬∑ **Nov. 17 & 18, 2020**¬† ‚Äì¬†48 hours

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423).
¬†
Refer to the table below to identify the test slot time in your time zone.
	¬∑ UTC-9 to UTC-2 ‚Äì¬†[Green test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Green+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3923&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC-1 to UTC+6 ‚Äì¬†[Yellow test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Yellow+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3915&ah=4)
	¬∑ UTC+7 to UTC-10 ‚Äì¬†[Blue test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Blue+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3909&ah=4)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "The Microsoft author signing certificate will be updated as soon as November 1st, 2020" (#47) at NuGet/Announcements

Tweets.Text:
‚ö† Deprecation notice ‚ö†
